de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.protokoll
Class TrustedAuthority

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.tubs.cs.iti.krypto.protokoll.TrustedAuthority
public class TrustedAuthority
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a trusted authority for key exchange protocols. Its methods allow the user to obtain a new certificate based on his system login information. The issued certificates are objects of the Certificate-class.
There are also methods to access the public part of the trusted authority's RSA key.

See Also:
Certificate

TrustedAuthority

public TrustedAuthority()
Method Detail

newCertificate

public static Certificate newCertificate(byte[] data)
Issues a new certificate to the caller containing the given data. The issued certificate contains the username under which the program calling this method is running. If no such username can be obtained a random String of length 50 is used as ID. The signature of the certificate is obtained by applying first the SHA hash function to the ID-String followed by data, see the MessageDigest-class. That is, if md is the SHA MessageDigest-object and ID is the ID-String, then newCertificate will call

md.update(ID.getBytes());
md.update(data);
digest = md.digest();

After that the resulting message digest digest of 128 bits is converted to a BigInteger-object by using the appropriate constructor and signed with the secret RSA key of the trusted authority. Important: When checking a certificate notice that because of the usage of RSA the two values to be compared are only equal modulo the trusted authorities modulus getModulus.
Parameters:
data - contains the data to be included in the certificate (e.g. a public RSA key).
See Also:
java.security.MessageDigest, BigInteger

getModulus

public static java.math.BigInteger getModulus()
Access method for the modulus of the RSA key of the trusted authority.
Returns:
the modulus n of the public key as BigInteger.

getPublicExponent

public static java.math.BigInteger getPublicExponent()
Access method for the exponent part of the public RSA key of the trusted authority.
Returns:
the exponent e of the public key as BigInteger.
